thread.title: Queen attends church for second Sunday after missing Christmas services with illness
thread.title_full: Queen attends church for second Sunday after missing Christmas services with illness

author: Tom Powell
title: Queen attends church for second Sunday after missing Christmas services with illness
text:
Sunday 15 January 2017 13:52 BST Click to followThe Evening Standard Queen Elizabeth II departs after attending a church service in Norfolk PA 
The Queen has attended church for the second Sunday this year after a heavy cold forced her to miss the Christmas services. 
The monarch was joined by her husband the Duke of Edinburgh at St Mary the Virgin Church in Flitcham, Norfolk. 
Also in attendance was David Armstrong-Jones, the second Earl of Snowdon, whose father died just two days earlier. 
The former husband of Princess Margaret and celebrity photographer Lord Snowdon died aged 86 on January 13. Queen Elizabeth II and the Duke of Edinburgh leaving the church (PA) 
Created First Earl of Snowdon in 1961, Antony Armstrong-Jones had two children with the Queen's sister Princess Margaret, their eldest now being the second Earl. 
The Queen missed her regular appearances at church on Christmas Day and New Year's Day because of the lingering respiratory illness. The Queen carried an umbrella to shield herself from the rain (PA) 
She and Philip had been forced to delay their journey from Buckingham Palace to their Norfolk estate in the days before Christmas after she fell ill. Royal family attend Sandringham Christmas service 2016 Royal family attend Sandringham Christmas service 2016 1/6 
The Queen was not in attendance due to illness PA Wire/PA Images 
Prince Harry outside the church on the Sandringham estate PA Wire/PA Images 
Princess Eugenie leaving the Christmas Day service PA Wire/PA Images 
The Duke of Edinburgh leaving the Christmas service PA Wire/PA Images 
The royal family arriving at the Christmas Day service at St Mary Magdalene Church PA Wire/PA Images 
The Duchess of Cornwall attended the service with Prince Charles PA Wire/PA Images 
The Queen today wore a purple coat and matching hat, carrying an umbrella to shield her from the morning rain. More about:
